intro.description1: Software & AI engineering for things people actually use.
intro.description2: Years of full-stack work, lately spent building agentic AI systems.

connect.title: LET'S CONNECT
connect.description: Open to new projects, collaborations, and the occasional honest conversation about software and AI.

experience.title: Experience
experience.description: Mostly: taking products from slide deck to something users can’t ignore.

SaaS.title: SaaS, from zero to "this actually works"
SaaS.description1: Early engineer at Metamaze, building an intelligent document processing platform from scratch—architecture, implementation, monitoring, and the unglamorous operational glue. Metamaze was acquired by Duco in 2024.
SaaS.description2: After Metamaze, I’ve shipped several SaaS-style products @ Faktion, from rough MVPs to platforms that had to survive real customers.
SaaS.nurture: I know what it takes to get a SaaS live—and what breaks if you don’t take care of it.

registry.title: Registries, inspired by shadcn
registry.description: I’ve built registries and component libraries so teams stop copy‑pasting buttons and start sharing them. Better developer ergonomics, fewer "why does this look different in this app" moments.

agentic.title: Generative AI & agentic systems
agentic.description1: At Faktion I’ve shipped 10+ agentic and generative-AI systems—agents, workflows, chatbots, tools—wired into real data and real businesses. More and more of my time goes here.
agentic.call-to-action: Visit Faktion to see some of my work (yes, I’m proud)

ownership.title: Ownership
ownership.description: I don’t throw code over the wall. I help decide what to build, how to build it, and how to keep it running when the novelty wears off.

packages.title: PACKAGES
packages.description: Small libraries I maintain so future me (and other people) spend less time fighting tooling.

iso-locale.title: @reacture-io/iso-locale
iso-locale.description: A TypeScript library for dealing with countries, languages, dialects, and currencies using ISO standards, with Zod keeping you from inventing your own formats by accident.
